about.title: Košice Fencing Guild
about.content: At KŠC, we are dedicated to practicing martial traditions of medieval and Renaissance Europe. We train with longswords, sabres, and more — focusing on skill, athletic performance, history, and community. Whether you're a beginner or experienced fencer, you'll find a welcoming place to learn and grow here.

content1.paragraph: HEMA, or Historical European Martial Arts, is the modern revival of Europe's forgotten fighting traditions. It's based on historical manuals and brings centuries-old martial traditions back to life through training and sparring

content2.paragraph: Unlike choreographed swordfighting you see in movies or historical events, HEMA is a martial art. Every move is rooted in historical sources and tested against a resisting partner. It's not about performing — it's about understanding how real swordplay works

content3.paragraph: The duels we study were fought in ordinary clothes, not armor, and our gear needs to reflect that. HEMA uses modern protective elements made from puncture-resistant fabrics and durable plastics. It's inspired by history but designed for safety, comfort, and mobility

content4.paragraph: HEMA offers the full package of a martial art. We train strength, endurance, coordination, and awareness — but also the mindset to push through the limits. Confidence, skill, and friendships are forged through the shared challenge of mastering this complex but rewarding discipline

content: KŠC kicked off as a small but quickly growing crew led by Slavomír Hubatka back in 2016, training simply out of passion for historical fencing. Unfortunately, pandemic paused our momentum and left us with just a handful of active fencers.
In 2023, with the help of Tomáš Klučár we rebuilt, formalized an official organization and opened up to new members.
While we're still young in the tournament scene, our head coach and founding member, Miroslav Medviď, stands among the world’s top HEMA fencers — a reflection of exceptional commitment to the craft.
Now, with experienced instructors like Filip 'Joxer' Trcka and a growing community of enthusiastic prospects, we're writing the next chapter of our story together.

join.intro: If you feel like starting fencing, you have two options: either wait for our recruitment event, which we hold once or twice a year, or join our already formed group of advanced fencers. Choose the path that suits you best.

beginner.title: Join Beginner Group
content: Our recruitment events are designed for complete beginners who want to start their HEMA journey the right way. We provide all necessary equipment, including protective gear and training weapons, so you can focus on learning the fundamentals.

During these structured courses, you'll learn proper techniques, safety protocols, and basic combat principles in a supportive environment with fellow beginners. This is the ideal path if you want to build a solid foundation before committing to purchasing your own equipment.

advanced.title: Join Advanced Group
content: This path is for those who already have experience with fencing or martial arts, or are absolutely certain that HEMA is their calling. You'll train alongside experienced fencers with full gear and real weapons, not plastic trainers.

This route requires dedication and a financial commitment—you'll need to purchase your own equipment and weapons as soon as possible (we can provide guidance and help with purchases). It's more challenging, but if you're committed and confident that HEMA is for you, this is the most efficient and fastest way to learn and grow as a fencer.

swordAndBuckler.name: Sword and Buckler
swordAndBuckler.description: A classic medieval combination offering both offense and defense. The buckler provides excellent protection while maintaining mobility and aggressive fighting style.

longsword.name: Longsword
longsword.description: The quintessential weapon of HEMA. Versatile and elegant, the longsword can be used for cutting, thrusting, and leverage techniques with both hands.

sabre.name: Military Sabre
sabre.description: Fast and dynamic cavalry weapon. Emphasizes swift cutting attacks and aggressive footwork, representing the martial traditions of Eastern European cavalry.

rapier.name: Rapier
rapier.description: The gentleman's dueling weapon of the Renaissance. Focused on precise thrusting techniques, footwork, and sophisticated blade control in civilian combat.

questions.question: Do I need any prior experience to join?
questions.answer: No prior experience is necessary! We welcome complete beginners and provide all the foundational training you need to start safely.

questions.question: What equipment do I need to bring?
questions.answer: For beginners, we provide all necessary equipment including protective gear and training weapons. As you progress, you may choose to invest in your own equipment.

questions.question: How much does it cost to join?
questions.answer: Membership fees vary depending on your commitment level. Contact us for current pricing information and available membership options.

questions.question: Is HEMA dangerous?
questions.answer: Like any contact sport, HEMA has inherent risks, but we prioritize safety through proper protective equipment, controlled training environments, and experienced instruction. Injuries are rare when proper protocols are followed.

questions.question: How often are training sessions?
questions.answer: We hold training sessions multiple times per week. The exact schedule varies, so please check our contact section or reach out directly for current training times.

questions.question: Can I try a class before committing?
questions.answer: Yes! We encourage prospective members to attend a trial session to experience HEMA firsthand. Contact us to arrange a visit.

questions.question: What age groups do you accept?
questions.answer: We primarily train adults and teenagers (typically 16+). For younger students, please contact us to discuss specific circumstances and possibilities.

questions.question: Do you compete in tournaments?
questions.answer: Yes, our members have the opportunity to compete in local and international HEMA tournaments. Competition is optional and encouraged for those interested in testing their skills.
